tetz42.util
Class ObjectInspecter

java.lang.Object
  tetz42.util.ObjectInspecter

public class ObjectInspecter
extends java.lang.Object

Inspects or Dumps any object and converts to readable format string.

[sample]
   import static tetz42.util.ObjectInspecter.*;
         :
     Logger.debug( inspecter("foo") );
     Logger.debug( dumper("The result object:\n", theResult) );

You can choose five algorithms against reference cycles.
- superRapid
     // Very fast. Error will occur if the parameter is a bean that has a reference of itself.
     Logger.debug( dumper(dto).superRapid() );

- rapid
     // Fast. Depends on its 'hashCode' or/and 'equals' method, it might not act properly.
     Logger.debug( dumper(dto).rapid() );

- normal
     // Normal. Depends on its 'hashCode' method, it might not act properly.
     Logger.debug( dumper(dto).normal() );

- safe
     // Safe.
     Logger.debug( dumper(dto) );

- superSafe
     // Very safe. Error won't occur if the parameter is a List, Set or Map that has a reference of itself.
     Logger.debug( dumper(list).superSafe() );

Version:
1.0
Author:
tetz

dumper(java.lang.Object...)

dumper

public static ObjectInspecter dumper(java.lang.Object... objs)
Creates an object to dump the parameters.

When 'toString' method of the object is called, the parameters will dump as follows:
- Array, List
  String[]@13b8f864[
    "foo"
    "bar"
    "baz"
  ]

- Map
  HashMap@54bb7759{
    "key1": "value1"
    "key2": "value2"
  }

- Bean
   Bean@7cf1bb78{
     intField = 10
     floatField = 10.0
     strField = "10"
   }

- mix
   HashMap@54bb7759{
     "key1": Bean@7cf1bb78{
       intField = 10
       floatField = 10.0
       mapField = HashMap@7f2a3793{
         "key1": 100
         "key2": 10000
       }
     }
     "key2": ArrayList@50d5db23[
       "foo"
       "bar"
       "baz"
     ]
   }

You can use this method as follows:
  Logger.debug( dumper("Contents of DTO = ", dto) );
- result
   [DEBUG] Contents of DTO = FooDTO@13b8f864{
     id = 42
     name = "Tetz"
     sex = "male"
     jobs = ArrayList@37bd2664[
       "IT engineer"
       "Farmer"
       "Husband"
       "Farther"
     ]
   }

The object returned does not do anything unless its 'toString' method is performed.
Therefore, if you use wise logging product like log4j, you need not care about performance problem when you write the code like below:
   log.debug( dumper("Result:\n", theResult) );
instead of:
   if( log.isDebugEnabled() ) {
     log.debug( dumper("Result:\n", theResult) );
   }
Because log4j does not perform 'toString' method unless the log is output.

Parameters:
objs - - objects to dump
Returns:
the object to dump parameters

superSafe

public ObjectInspecter superSafe()
Changes the algorithm to most safe type.

[sample]
   Logger.debug( dumper(dto).superSafe() );

Returns:
a reference to this object

safe

public ObjectInspecter safe()
Changes the algorithm to safe type.

[sample]
   Logger.debug( dumper(dto).safe() );

By default, this type is selected.

Returns:
a reference to this object
